void.string: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xml:lang="en-US"> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/news.xml</id> <updated>2007-03-08T20:51:43.502-06:00</updated> <generator uri="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere" version="1.0.2.0">Atomsphere</generator> <title>News:</title> <author> <name>Bill Brown</name> <uri>http://www.colorfulsoftware.com</uri> <email>support@colorfulsoftware.com</email> </author> <link href="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/atom.xml" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml"/> <rights>Copyright 2007</rights> <entry> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/news.xml#Atomsphere%201.0.2.0</id> <updated>2007-02-24T20:14:05.945-06:00</updated> <title>Atomsphere 1.0.2.0</title> <link href="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere" rel="alternate" type="text/html"/> <published>2007-02-24T20:11:54.804-06:00</published> <summary>heavy updates to atomsphere-taglib and atomsphere-weblib</summary> <content type="xhtml"><div>heavy updates to atomsphere-taglib and atomsphere-weblib</div></content> </entry> <entry> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/atom.xml#Atomsphere%201.0.1.0</id> <updated>2006-11-26T18:40:00.00-06:00</updated> <title>Atomsphere 1.0.1.0</title> <author> <name>Bill Brown</name> <uri>http://www.colorfulsoftware.com</uri> <email>info@colorfulsoftware.com</email> </author> <link href="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere" rel="alternate" type="text/html"/> <category term="feed library"/> <published>2006-11-26T18:40:00.00-06:00</published> <rights>GPL</rights> <summary>new artifact structures, features and bug fix release.</summary> <content type="text">The new sturcture for the released code now contians four parts: atomsphere (the atom feed spec library), atomsphere-taglib (a taglib to put in your view), atomsphere-weblib (the servlets for maintaining feeds) and the atomsphere-webapp (an example app using all of the components). Check it out on the projects page.</content> </entry> <entry> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.com/atom.xml#Atomsphere%201.0.0</id> <updated>2006-06-15T13:45:00.00-06:00</updated> <title>Atomsphere 1.0.0</title> <link href="http://colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere" rel="alternate" type="text/html"/> <published>2006-06-15T18:49:00.00-06:00</published> <rights>GPL</rights> <summary>java open source library</summary> <content type="text">Atomsphere is a java library for creating and modifying Atom 1.0 compliant feed documents. It's also bundled with a servlet based web interface for front-end manipulation of atom feeds. Visit the homepage for more info http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere or follow the projects link from the main menu. </content> </entry></feed>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xml:lang="en-US"> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/projects/atomsphere/atom.xml</id> <updated>2007-03-08T20:52:40.70-06:00</updated> <generator uri="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere" version="1.0.2.0">Atomsphere</generator> <title>Atomsphere</title> <subtitle>a java atom feed library</subtitle> <author> <name>Bill Brown</name> <uri>http://www.colorfulsoftware.com</uri> <email>info@colorfulsoftware.com</email> </author> <link href="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere/atom.xml" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml"/> <rights>Copyright 2007</rights> <entry> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/colorfulsoftware/projects/atomsphere/atom.xml#About</id> <updated>2007-03-02T13:00:00.699-06:00</updated> <title>About</title> <published>2007-02-26T12:34:01.330-06:00</published> <summary>About the project</summary> <content type="xhtml"><ul> <li><span class="boldText">Atomsphere</span> is a java library that allows you to create and modify atom 1.0 feeds.</li> <li>It is distributed under the GNU GPL license and can be used in any manner complient with the license.</li> <li>It is also packaged as a servlet-lib for use in web applications.</li> <li>It is also packaged as a custom tag library to display feeds on a webapage.</li> <li>It also comes with an example webapp which demonstrates some example uses of the library.</li> <li>It is written to be tied as closely as possible to the current atom specification found <a href="http://www.atomenabled.org/developers/syndication/atom-format-spec.php">here</a>.</li> </ul></content> </entry> <entry> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/colorfulsoftware/projects/atomsphere/atom.xml#Requirements</id> <updated>2007-03-02T12:59:54.274-06:00</updated> <title>Requirements</title> <published>2007-02-26T12:58:53.197-06:00</published> <summary>Requirements for using the libraries</summary> <content type="xhtml"><br />the project is usable with jdk 1.4.2 and above<br /> &nbsp;<br /> needed for using the library<br /> <ul> <li><a href="https://sjsxp.dev.java.net/">jsr173</a> (STAX api jar) - see the <a href="http://jcp.org/aboutJava/communityprocess/final/jsr173/index.html">API</a>.</li> <li><a href="https://sjsxp.dev.java.net/">sjsxp</a> (STAX implementation) - others implementations may work but have not been tested.</li> <li><a href="https://stax-utils.dev.java.net/">stax-utils</a> (for pretty printing)</li> </ul> needed for using the atomsphere-taglib<br /> <ul> <li>the atomsphere library</li> <li>Any J2EE Servlet Container</li> </ul> needed for using the atomsphere-weblib<br /> <ul> <li>the atomsphere library</li> <li>Any J2EE Servlet Container</li> </ul> needed for using the example atomsphere-webapp<br /> <ul> <li>Any J2EE Servlet Container</li></ul></content> </entry> <entry> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/colorfulsoftware/projects/atomsphere/atom.xml#Documentation</id> <updated>2007-03-02T12:59:45.475-06:00</updated> <title>Documentation</title> <published>2007-02-26T13:00:00.478-06:00</published> <summary>Starting Documentation</summary> <content type="xhtml"><h4>Installation (atomsphere library)</h4> <ul> <li>Add the jsr173, sjsxp, stax-utils and atomsphere jars to the classpath (WEB-INF/lib for webapps).</li> </ul> <h4>Installation (atomsphere-taglib)</h4> <ul> <li>Add the atomsphere jar to the classpath (WEB-INF/lib for webapps).</li><li>Add the atomsphereTags.tld tag descriptor to the top of the jsp page (See example below). </li> <li>Add any required attributes and optional attributes to the custom tag (See example below).</li> <li>View the atomsphereTags.tld for a description of the attributes and what they do.</li></ul> <h4>Installation (atomsphere-weblib)</h4> <ul><li>Add the atomsphere and atomsphere-weblib jars to the classpath (WEB-INF/lib for webapps).</li><li>Copy the web-fragrment.xml (embeded in the jar file) to your application's web.xml file.</li></ul> <h4>Installation (atomsphere-webapp)</h4> <ul> <li>Deploy the war file to any J2EE servlet container.</li> </ul></content> </entry> <entry> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/colorfulsoftware/projects/atomsphere/atom.xml#Examples</id> <updated>2007-03-02T12:59:10.517-06:00</updated> <title>Examples</title> <published>2007-02-26T13:01:43.57-06:00</published> <summary>Basic examples</summary> <content type="xhtml"><br />Read an atom xml file into a Feed bean<br /> <code> Feed feed = FeedDoc.readFeedToBean(new File(fullPath)); </code><br />&nbsp;<br /> Read an atom URL into a Feed bean<br /> <code> Feed feed = FeedDoc.readFeedToBean(new URL("http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/atom.xml")); </code><br />&nbsp;<br /> Read an atom xml file into an xml atom string<br /> <code> String atomXML = FeedDoc.readFeedToString(new File(fullPath)); </code><br />&nbsp;<br /> Write a feed bean into an xml file<br /> <code> FeedDoc.writeFeedDoc(fullPath,feed,FeedDoc.encoding,FeedDoc.xml_version); </code><br />&nbsp;<br /> Add the custom feed tag to a jsp page.<br /> <code> &lt;%@taglib uri="/WEB-INF/atomsphereTags.tld" prefix="atom" %&gt;</code><br />...<br /><code>&lt;atom:atomFeed </code><br /><code> clazz="myFeed"</code><br /><code> url="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/atom.xml"</code><br /><code>feedSummary="true"</code><br /><code>entryUpdated="true"</code><br /><code>entryUpdatedFormat="yyyy-MM-dd" /&gt;</code><br />&nbsp;<br /></content> </entry></feed>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xml:lang="en-US"> <id>http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/projects/atomsphere/releaseNotes.xml</id> <updated>2007-03-08T20:53:16.88-06:00</updated> <generator uri="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere" version="1.0.2.0">Atomsphere</generator> <title>Release Notes</title> <author> <name>Bill Brown</name> <uri>http://www.colorfulsoftware.com</uri> </author> <link href="http://www.colorfulsoftware.com/projects/atomsphere/releaseNotes.xml" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml"/> <rights>Copyright 2007</rights> <entry> <id> http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/projects/atomsphere/releaseNotes.xml#1.0.2.0 </id> <updated>2007-03-06T20:36:25.428-06:00</updated> <title>1.0.2.0</title> <published>2007-03-06T20:12:08.470-06:00</published> <summary>Release Notes</summary> <content type="xhtml"> <h3>atomsphere library</h3><ul><li>removed previous deprecated methods.</li><li>deprecated extension constructor with xmlns namespace parameter in favor of adding an attribute to the feed element.</li><li>added support for the <a href="http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/projects/atomsphere/extension/sort/1.0/sort.rnc">sort extension</a></li></ul><h3>atomsphere-taglib</h3><ul><li>added support for optionally displaying missing feed elements. The attribute syntax has changed. see the taglib descriptor file for updated syntax.</li></ul><h3>atomsphere-weblib</h3><ul><li>fixed bug with "Feed Admin" link. It now goes to the main admin page.</li><li>make the stylesheet config param allow a relative url.</li><li>enable multiples for the author, contributor, link and category elements.</li><li>enable atomTextConstruct text for fields that allow this. Mainly allow html to be used as input where needed.</li><li>implemented sorting by updated date or entry title. See the <a href="http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/projects/atomsphere/extension/sort/1.0/sort.rnc">sort extension</a></li><li>implemented a feed "preview" page to allow you to verify your changes before commiting.</li><li>added an error page for displaying user input errors.</li></ul><h3>atomsphere-webapp</h3><ul><li>updated example page with new version of the atomsphere-taglib.</li></ul> </content> </entry> <entry> <id> http://colorfulsoftware.localhost/projects/atomsphere/releaseNotes.xml#1.0.1.0 </id> <updated>2006-11-26T18:40:00.00-06:00</updated> <title>1.0.1.0</title> <published>2006-11-26T18:40:00.00-06:00</published> <summary>Release Notes</summary> <content type="xhtml"> <h3>atomsphere library</h3><ul><li>deprecated some of the feed doc methods</li><li>added support for reading feeds from URL's</li><li>added more documentation to the javadocs</li></ul><h3>atomsphere-taglib</h3><ul><li>Added custom tag for displaying feeds on a webpage</li></ul> </content> </entry> <entry> <id> http://localhost:8080/colorfulsoftware/projects/atomsphere/releaseNotes.xml#1.0.0%20Beta </id> <updated>2006-06-15T18:49:00.00-06:00</updated> <title>1.0.0 Beta</title> <published>2006-06-15T18:49:00.00-06:00</published> <summary>Initial Release</summary> <content type="xhtml"> <div>Introducing the Atomsphere library. binaries and source available on http://sourceforge.net. This library helps you add atom syndication to your java web applications. </div> </content> </entry></feed>
